message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses a combination of household survey data from the LSMS and administrative data from the Brazilian government to assess the impact of the Bolsa Família program on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["LSMS", "administrative data from the Brazilian government"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the relationship between temperature and infant mortality in sub-Saharan African countries using monthly weather data from CHIRPS and demographic data from DHS.", "dataset": ["CHIRPS", "DHS"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the effects of foreign aid on political polarization in Africa, we use cross-national data on political coalitions from the Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) dataset and foreign aid data from AidData.", "dataset": ["Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem)", "AidData"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws on two datasets: World Bank Enterprise Surveys and trade statistics from COMTRADE to examine the relationship between innovation and firm-level exports in developing economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "COMTRADE"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a mediation framework with monthly data on COVID-19 cases and deaths from the Our World in Data repository and data on mobility from Google Community Mobility Reports to explore the role of mobility in COVID-19 transmission.", "dataset": ["Our World in Data", "Google Community Mobility Reports"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using a global panel dataset on forests from Global Forest Watch and geospatial data on land use from Land Use Harmonization 2.1, we estimate the causal effect of deforestation on local temperatures.", "dataset": ["Global Forest Watch", "Land Use Harmonization 2.1"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study exploits the spatial variation in rainwater storage from CHIRPS and household survey data from LSMS to examine the effects of rainfall shocks on income diversification strategies of rural households.", "dataset": ["CHIRPS", "LSMS"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the impact of renewable energy subsidies on electricity generation, we assemble a novel dataset by merging regulation data on feed-in tariffs from the Global Atlas for Renewable Energy with production data from the International Energy Agency.", "dataset": ["Global Atlas for Renewable Energy", "International Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite remote sensing data from NASA's Terra and Aqua satellites with surveys on crop yields, pesticide use and profiles of land conditions from USAID's Bureau of Humanitarian Assistance to estimate the impact of climate variability on food security.", "dataset": ["NASA's Terra and Aqua satellites", "USAID's Bureau of Humanitarian Assistance"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs hospital discharge data from the Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation to investigate the effects of smoking on asthma incidence.", "dataset": ["Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation"], "topic": ["Health"]} ]

content: [{"sentence": "This study uses a combination of household survey data from the LSMS and administrative data from the Brazilian government to assess the impact of the Bolsa Família program on poverty reduction.", "dataset": ["LSMS", "administrative data from the Brazilian government"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the relationship between temperature and infant mortality in sub-Saharan African countries using monthly weather data from CHIRPS and demographic data from DHS.", "dataset": ["CHIRPS", "DHS"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "To analyze the effects of foreign aid on political polarization in Africa, we use cross-national data on political coalitions from the Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem) dataset and foreign aid data from AidData.", "dataset": ["Varieties of Democracy (V-Dem)", "AidData"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws on two datasets: World Bank Enterprise Surveys and trade statistics from COMTRADE to examine the relationship between innovation and firm-level exports in developing economies.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "COMTRADE"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", Mobility Reports to explore the role of mobility in COVID-19 transmission.", "dataset": ["Our World in Data", "Google Community Mobility Reports"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using a global panel dataset on forests from Global Forest Watch and geospatial data on land use from Land Use Harmonization 2.1, we estimate the causal effect of deforestation on local temperatures.", "dataset": ["Global Forest Watch", "Land Use Harmonization 2.1"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "This study exploits the spatial variation in rainwater storage from CHIRPS and household survey data from LSMS to examine the effects of rainfall shocks on income diversification strategies of rural households.", "dataset": ["CHIRPS", "LSMS"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "To assess the impact of renewable energy subsidies on electricity generation, we assemble a novel dataset by merging regulation data on feed-in tariffs from the Global Atlas for Renewable Energy with production data from the International Energy Agency.", "dataset": ["Global Atlas for Renewable Energy", "International Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We combine satellite remote sensing data from NASA's Terra and Aqua satellites with surveys on crop yields, pesticide use and profiles of land conditions from USAID's Bureau of Humanitarian Assistance to estimate the impact of climate variability on food security.", "dataset": ["NASA's Terra and Aqua satellites", "USAID's Bureau of Humanitarian Assistance"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs hospital discharge data from the Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation to investigate the effects of smoking on asthma incidence.", "dataset": ["Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation"], "topic": ["Health"]} ]
